intro: Sida goyazensis, commonly known as the Brazilian mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Sida goyazensis is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as cotton and hibiscus. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
